title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She did not regret the time she had spent away from her desk, particularly the previous day's trip to West Linton.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She left him to his mood and his silence, but just before they reached West Linton itself, he pointed to a house some distance off the road, a large stone house with windows facing a stretch of moor.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: For several minutes he said nothing, and then he had agreed, with the result that now they were making their way out to West Linton, with Isabel at the wheel of her old green Swedish car.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: I went out to West Linton and spoke to the mother.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The village of West Linton clung to the side of a hill.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She liked the road out to West Linton, and always had.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: But I looked up J. Macleod in the phone book and there's a J. Macleod in West Linton.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The other Macleod, Gavin, lived just outside town, in West Linton.

title: Bertie's Guide to Life and Mothers
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: He liked the short horizons in these glens; the occasional views of higher hills in the distance; the secrets of small villages that seemed to have changed so little over the years; the names that spoke of distances and colours and the points of the compass – Nine Mile Burn, Silverburn, West Linton.

title: Our Laddie
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: " I jist got Maister Wormald, the writer,o' West Linton, to draw up a bit will for me."
